idrvdof

value

(integer) : begining of bodys' index that will be written
ito

briefdescription.para: Read DOF file.

detaileddescription.para: If num <= 0 : DATBOX/DOF.INI file is read
Else : OUTBOX/DOF.OUT.num is read, num being the parameter used in TimeEvolution_ReadIniDof last call

usage : RBDY3_ReadIniDof(num=0)
num
(integer) : which DOF file to read

: index of the RBDY3

idbdy(integer)

: rank of the RBDY3
density(double) : density of the RBDY3

python usage : inertia = RBDY3_GetBodyInertia(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
inertia (double array) : inertia vector of the desired RBDY3

briefdescription.para: Get the inertia of a all RBDY3 body.

detaileddescription.para:
usage : inertia = RBDY3_GetAllInertia()
inertia
(double array): the inertia of all bodies

briefdescription.para: python usage : RBDY3_CollectBodiesDotOUT()
python usage : RBDY3_AppendToBodiesDotOUT()
python usage : RBDY3_RebuildBodiesDotDAT()
Set a vector of a RBDY3 body.

detaileddescription.para:
Possible values for datatype field are:
"Coor0": reference coordinates
"X____": cumulated displacements over time in computed configuration
"Xbeg_": cumulated displacements over time at beginning of time step
"V____": velocity in computed configuration
"Vbeg_": velocity at beginning of time step
"Vfree": velocity free of contacts
"Reac_": contact reaction force
"Raux_": working array for reaction force
"Ireac": contact impulse
"Iaux_": working array for impulste
"Fext_": external forces
uses copy, and in case of Fext, the operation is not just setting but adding

python usage : RBDY3_PutBodyVector(datatype, ibdyty, vector)
datatype
(string [5]) : the vector to set
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
vector
(double array) : the new value of the vector

briefdescription.para: Put an array of a vector of all RBDY3 bodies (visible and invisible)

detaileddescription.para: Possible values for datatype field are: ... see RBDY3_PutBodyVector

python usage : RBDY3_PutAllBodyVector(datatype, matrix)
datatype
(string [5]) : the vector to set
matrix
(double array) : input matrix

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of a vector of a RBDY3 body.

detaileddescription.para:
Possible values for datatype field are:
"Coor0": reference coordinates
"Coor_": coordinates in computed configuration
"Coorb": coordinates at beginning of time step
"Coorm": coordinates in detection configuration
"X____": cumulated displacements over time in computed configuration
"Xbeg_": cumulated displacements over time at beginning of time step
"V____": velocity in computed configuration
"Vbeg_": velocity at beginning of time step
"Vaux_": working array for velocity
"Vfree": velocity free of contacts
"Reac_": contact reaction force
"Raux_": working array for reaction force
"Ireac": contact impulse
"Iaux_": working array for impulste
"Fext_": external forces
"Fint_": internal forces

python usage : vector = RBDY3_GetBodyVector(datatype, ibdyty)
datatype
(string [5]) : the vector to get
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
vector (double array) : output vector

briefdescription.para: Get an array of a vector of all RBDY3 bodies (visible and invisible)

detaileddescription.para: Possible values for datatype field are: ... see RBDY3_GetBodyVector

python usage : matrix = RBDY3_GetBodyVector(datatype, ibdyty)
datatype
(string [5]) : the vector to get
matrix (double array) : output matrix

briefdescription.para: Get a pointer on a vector of a RBDY3 body.

detaileddescription.para:
Possible values for datatype field are:
"Coor0": reference coordinates
"X____": cumulated displacements over time in computed configuration
"Xbeg_": cumulated displacements over time at beginning of time step
"V____": velocity in computed configuration
"Vbeg_": velocity at beginning of time step
"Vaux_": working array for velocity
"Ireac": contact impulse
"Iaux_": working array for impulste
"Fext_": external forces

python usage : vector_ptr = RBDY3_GetPtrBodyVector(datatype, ibdyty)
datatype
(string [5]) : the vector to set
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
vector_ptr (double array) : reference on the desired vector seen as a numpy array

memberdef.argsstring: (char *cvalue1, int ivalue1, double *matrix_in, int dim1, int dim2)
memberdef.name: RBDY3_PutBodyMatrix

briefdescription.para: Set a matrix of a RBDY3 body.

detaileddescription.para:
Possible values for datatype field are:
"IFbeg": inertia frame at beginning of time step
"IFTT_": inertia frame in detection configuration
"IF___": inertia frame in computed configuration
Uses copy

python usage : RBDY3_PutBodyMatrix(datatype, ibdyty, matrix)
datatype
(string [5]) : the vector to set
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
matrix
(double array) : a matrix

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of a matrix of a RBDY3 body.

detaileddescription.para:
Possible values for datatype field are:
"IFref": inertia frame in reference configuration
"IFbeg": inertia frame at beginning of time step
"IFTT_": inertia frame in detection configuration
"IF___": inertia frame in computed configuration
Uses copy

python usage : matrix = RBDY3_GetBodyMatrix(datatype, ibdyty)
datatype
(string [5]) : the vector to get
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
matrix (double array) : output matrix

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of a real data of all rbdy3.

detaileddescription.para: In this order : coor, frame, vlocy, spin, fext, reac

python usage : rdata = RBDY3_GetAllRData()
rdata (double array) : output matrix

briefdescription.para: get the number of RBDY3

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : nb_RBDY3 = RBDY3_GetNbRBDY3()
nb_RBDY3 (integer) : number of RBDY3 in container

briefdescription.para: Get the mass of a body.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mass = RBDY3_GetMass(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
mass (double) : mass of the RBDY3

briefdescription.para: Get the mass of a all body (visible and invisible)

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : masses = RBDY3_GetAllMass()
masses (double array) : masses of all RBDY3

briefdescription.para: Get a pointer onto the mass matrix of a body.
Get the velocity of a body.
Get the global inertia.

detaileddescription.para:
usage : inertia = RBDY3_GetGlobInertia(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : id of desired RBDY3
inertia (double 2D array) : the inertia matrix

briefdescription.para: Get the type of the nickname of the behavior.

detaileddescription.para:
usage name = RBDY3_GetBehavior(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3 in container
type (string) : nickname

briefdescription.para: get the number of contactor of RBDY3

detaileddescription.para: python usage : nb = RBDY3_GetNbContactor(ibdyty)

parameterdescription.para: (integer) : rank of the RBDY3 in container

simplesect.para: nb (integer) : number of contactor attached to a RBDY3

briefdescription.para: Get the type of the itacty contactor of a body ibdyty.

detaileddescription.para:
usage type = RBDY3_GetContactorType(ibdyty,itacty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3 in container
itacty
(integer) : rank of the contactor in the RBDY3
type (string) : type of the contactor of the body

briefdescription.para: Set the color of a given contactor of a body.

detaileddescription.para:
usage : RBDY3_SetContactorColor(ibdyty, itacty, color)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
itacty
(integer) : rank of the contactor in the RBDY3
color
(string of size 5) : the color

briefdescription.para: Get the color of the itacty contactor of a body ibdyty.

detaileddescription.para:
usage color = RBDY3_GetContactorColor(ibdyty,itacty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3 in container
itacty
(integer) : rank of the contactor in the RBDY3
color (string) : color of the contactor of the body

briefdescription.para: Get the driven dof of a body.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : [drvdof_indices, drvdof_values] = RBDY3_getDrvVlocy(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : index of the RBDY3
drvdof_indices
(integer array) : indices list of driven dof
drvdof_values
(real array) : values of the driven dof

briefdescription.para: Compute the value of the driven velocity of a body at current time.

detaileddescription.para: In place replacement in the input array of the new value(s) of the driven velocity

python usage : RBDY3_computeDrvVlocy(ibdyty, values)
ibdyty
(integer) : index of the RBDY3
values
(double array) : numpy array, input old values of imposed velocity, output new ones

briefdescription.para: write a bdyty to BODIES.OUT with a given rank

python usage : RBDY3_WriteOutOneBody(ibdyty, new_ibdyty)
ibdyty

new_ibdyty

python usage : RBDY3_WriteOutDofOneBody(ibdyty, new_ibdyty)
ibdyty

new_ibdyty

: some dispersion coefficient

itacty

briefdescription.para: Initialization of data for the equilibrium state check.

detaileddescription.para:
You must precise the type of check test :
Qvlcy : quadratic norm velocy
Mvlcy : maximum norm velocy

usage : RBDY3_CheckEquilibrium(norm_type , tolerance)
norm_type
(string of size 5) : norm type use for the equilibrium check
tolerance
(double) : norm tolerance

briefdescription.para: check if all the RBDY3 rich an equilibrium state (velocity is almost equal to zero)

detaileddescription.para: usage : isBalanced = RBDY3_CheckEquilibriumState()

simplesect.para: isBalanced (boolean) : True if in equilibrium state

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : RBDY3_SetSourcePoint(first_RBDY3, radius, Xshift, Yshift, Zshift)
first_RBDY3(int)
: number of first invisible body
radius
: source point area radius
Xshift
: X translation of deposited object from reference coordinate
Yshift
: Y translation of deposited object from reference coordinate
Zshift
: Z translation of deposited object from reference coordinate

: number of first invisible body

Yshift

zini

dz

memberdef.argsstring: (double xmin, double xmax, double ymin, double ymax, double radius)
memberdef.name: RBDY3_InitFreeBoundary

briefdescription.para: python usage : RBDY3_InitFreeBoundary(xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, radius)

memberdef.argsstring: (int num_down, int num_right, int num_up, int num_left, int num_front, int num_rear, int nb_loads, double *rvector_in, int rlength_in)
memberdef.name: RBDY3_TriaxialLoading

briefdescription.para: Triaxial load of a sample using a rigid box.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : TriaxialLoading(num_down, num_right, num_up, num_left, num_front, num_rear, nb_loads, loads)
num_down
(integer) :
num_right
(integer) :
num_up
(integer) :
num_left
(integer) :
num_front
(integer) :
num_rear
(integer) :
nb_loads
(integer) : the number of walls you want to load with a pressure (1 to 6)
loads
(array) : loads(2,nb_loads): load(1,i) contains which wall is loaded (1==down, 2==right, 3==up, 4==left, 5==front, 6==rear) and load(2,i) contains the amplitude of the stress (a positive value means compression).

briefdescription.para: Get dof status.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : status = RBDY3_GetDofStatus(ibdyty)
ibdyty(integer)
: rank of the RBDY3
status(integer) : dof status of the RBDY3
